**The Holy Annotation of Master Zhongyang on the *Five Chapters of Sacred Texts***

**Preface**
This text is the supreme treasure of *Jindan* [alchemical elixir]. It cannot be passed on to just anyone. If one of the highest caliber—great virtue’s heir—encounters this book, it is the true path to immortality.

Master Zhongyang’s Holy Annotation says:
Immortals are divided into five ranks. *Gui xian* [ghostly immortals] are unworthy of pursuit; *ren xian* [human immortals] need not be discussed. *Di xian* [earthly immortals] dwell in the world for many years. *Shen xian* [spiritual immortals] emerge and vanish beyond measure, hidden yet manifest, possessing a body beyond the body. Those who can dual their essence—these are called *shen xian* [spiritual immortals].

*Tian xian* [celestial immortals] stand above *shen xian* [spiritual immortals]. Seekers of the Dao/Way should not be content with mediocre or lower ranks. They must study the supreme and ultimate truth of the highest vehicle, the wondrous Dao/Way beyond compare.

To penetrate the mysteries of Heaven and Earth’s yin-yang, to grasp the transformations of the Five Phases [wood, fire, earth, metal, water]. The words *yin* and *yang* hold the greatest principle—Heaven, Earth, sun, moon, and the Five Phases all arise from them.

When the *Tai ji* [Supreme Ultimate] was divided, the pure *qi* ascended to form celestial phenomena; the turbid *qi* descended to shape terrestrial forms. The essence of wood and fire became the *Tai yang* [Greater Yang, the sun]; the splendor of metal and water became the *Tai yin* [Greater Yin, the moon]. Heaven, Earth, sun, and moon are born from the interplay of these two *qi*, transforming into existence.

These two *qi* circulate endlessly between Heaven and Earth, generating all things. Yet, as for human life—it draws upon the father’s vital essence and the mother’s blood, Heaven’s *yang qi*, Earth’s *yin qi*, the sun’s *yang hun* [soul], the moon’s *yin po* [spirit], fire’s *yang shen* [spirit], and water’s *yin jing* [essence]. Within a single human body, the transformations mirror those of Heaven and Earth, sharing the same *qi*.

Heaven and Earth are humanity’s grand progenitors. Those who awaken transcend the yin-yang of Heaven and Earth; those who remain deluded sink into the suffering of the myriad phenomena. To be unbound by the Five Phases’ constraints and yin-yang’s shackles—this is the highest rank of *tian xian* [celestial immortals]. Those who fail to awaken descend with the Creator, alas!

Master Zhongyang’s Holy Annotation says:
*Tian xin* [Heavenly Mind] is the true, wondrous heart of *Miao yuan* [profound unity]. The *Shi jie* [Buddhist teachings] call it the *Miao ming zhen xin* [wondrously clear true mind]. The mind is inherently wondrous and clear, untouched by defilement, pure and unadulterated. The slightest attachment is called delusion.

This mind is the root of the *Tai ji* [Supreme Ultimate], the formless void, the origin of yin-yang, the heart of Heaven and Earth—thus it is called *Tian xin* [Heavenly Mind]. The *Yuan shen* [Primordial Spirit] is the unborn, unending, incorruptible true essence, not the errant heart of thought and fancy. *Tian xin* [Heavenly Mind] governs the *Yuan shen* [Primordial Spirit], while the *Yuan shen* [Primordial Spirit] manifests the wondrous workings of *Tian xin* [Heavenly Mind].

Thus, the *Ru ru* [thusness, immovable] *Miao yuan Tian xin* [wondrously unified Heavenly Mind] is the master, while the *Bu huai bu mie* [unperishable, unobscured] *Ling miao Yuan shen* [wondrously subtle Primordial Spirit] is its function.

The Three Treasures [Buddha, Dao, Patriarch] serve as its foundation: the outer Three Treasures are not lost, and the inner Three Treasures are naturally harmonized.

Master Zhongyang’s Holy Annotation says:
The inner Three Treasures are *jing* [essence], *qi* [energy], and *shen* [spirit]; the outer Three Treasures are the ears, eyes, and mouth. One must seal them shut—do not let them leak.

If the eyes gaze upon colors, the spirit leaks through the eyes;
if the ears listen to sounds, the essence leaks through the ears;
if the mouth speaks, the *qi* leaks through the mouth.
When sight, hearing, and speech are stirred by external forces, the essence, energy, and spirit are daily consumed within. Gradually, one weakens and ages; when exhausted, death follows.

The Three Treasures are preserved when:
the eyes do not wander in vain,
the ears do not listen in vain,
the mouth does not speak in vain—
this is called the outer Three Treasures not leaking.
The eyes do not see, and the spirit remains in the heart;
the ears do not hear, and the essence remains in the kidneys;
the mouth does not speak, and the *qi* remains in the *Dan tian* [elixir field]—
this is called the inner Three Treasures naturally contained.

At first, one attains harmony between Heaven and humanity. The *qi* of the primordial Dao/Way naturally returns to its source.

Master Zhongyang’s Holy Annotation says:
*Tian* [Heaven] refers to the *qi* of the primordial Dao/Way;
*Ren* [humanity] refers to the form of the post-heavenly body.
Those who cultivate immortality must, in all their actions—whether moving, resting, sitting, or lying—nurture the *Ru ru bu dong Tian xin* [immovable Heavenly Mind] and the *Ling miao bu mie Yuan shen* [unobscured Primordial Spirit]. Thus, the eyes will not wander in vain, the ears will not listen in vain, and the mouth will not speak in vain. The inner truth responds externally, and the primordial *qi* naturally harmonizes, returning to my body from the void.

Yet, within a human’s inner and outer self, the Four Great [elements] above and below are all post-heavenly yin-yang. Only the primordial point of supreme *yang qi* remains, hidden in the unfathomable depths, utterly subtle and wondrous, difficult to seek or perceive.

Master Zhongyang’s Holy Annotation says:
Within a human body, there are the four limbs and myriad bones externally, and the five viscera and six bowels internally. Even tears, saliva, *jin jing* [semen and vaginal fluids], *qi*, blood, and fluids—all are tangible forms, belonging to post-heavenly turbid yin. This single point of supreme *yang qi* is the primordial *Zhen yi* [true unity] *qi* of the Dao/Way, called the *Tai yi* [Great Unity] *Han zhen qi* [containing true *qi*].

The "dim and indistinct" refers to the source of the primordial Dao/Way’s emergence. To reveal this supreme *yang qi* of the Dao/Way, there is no other method—only the practice of stillness.

The Dao/Way of stillness lies in dispelling delusive thoughts. Observing that the body is entirely empty, motionless and tranquil, suddenly the true *yang* appears in the dim and indistinct—sometimes present, sometimes absent, unfathomable, beyond sight or measure, neither inner nor outer, arising without knowing how. Thus it is.

Master Zhongyang’s Holy Annotation says:
All things carry yin within and embrace *yang*. Though a human’s Four Great [elements] belong to turbid yin, within lies a point of primordial *Yuan yang* [original *yang*], inherently endowed with innate knowledge and ability, inherently wondrous and clear.

Yet, the seven emotions and six desires assault from within, while cold, labor, heat, and toil strike from without, scattering the primordial *yang* and leaving one unaware, descending with the transformations of fate!

To know and cultivate—retracting sight and listening, forgetting external things while embracing the true—sight and hearing do not leak through sounds and colors; the wondrous and subtle do not leak through thoughts and fancies. The true essence is naturally preserved, and the primordial spirit is naturally replenished. The inner truth responds externally, and the primordial *qi* emerges from the void, illuminating the *Jindan* [alchemical elixir] within the body. Thus, though it comes from without, it is truly born within.

The mother-*qi* conceals the child-*qi*, the spirit embraces the *qi*, and the *qi* embraces the spirit. At this juncture, the *dantian* grows warm, the three passes ascend and descend in harmony, the upper and lower merge in balance—*tíhuò* [clarified butter] pours upon the crown, sweet dew showers the heart, the celestial *jiǔtiān* [wondrous music] resounds ever in the ears, the supreme treasure of the *xuánzhū* [mysterious pearl] is ever seen in the eyes. This is the true manifestation—no mere metaphor.

*"True essence returned to the Yellow Room of Gold,*
*A single bright pearl forever undivided."*

Is this idle speech? If the primordial had no dependence on the subsequent, how could it be summoned and gathered? If the subsequent fails to grasp the primordial, how could it transform and adapt? This is the emergence of being from non-being, and non-being from being. Non-being stirs into form through the impetus of being; being awakens to subtlety through the resonance of non-being. The *qi* of the two heavens—primordial and subsequent—responds like echoes to sound.

The Venerable Lord of Double Yang’s sacred annotation states:
*The primordial enters the formless void;
The subsequent lingers in tangible form.
The primordial is the heart—true, pure, wondrous, and clear;
The subsequent is the body—complete and solemn in its fullness.*

The primordial’s wondrous, clear, and true nature is inherently pure and untainted. From beginningless time, a single thought has hung like a pearl, until today. If it fails to summon the subsequent’s complete form, then the yin-spirit remains solitary and refined. The subsequent’s complete form, if it lacks the primordial’s wondrous and subtle essence, cannot transform or awaken to subtlety—how then could it transcend the mundane and attain sainthood?

For life and nature are the root of spirit and *qi*. *Qi* is the water of Heaven’s One; spirit is the True One containing essence. Nature is the form within non-being; life is the void within being. Life without nature lacks vitality; nature without life cannot stand. Non-being is the primordial nature, the spirit of True Unity; being is the subsequent life, the *qi* of True Unity’s essence.

This tangible yin-substance, born from a single point of formless yang-*qi*, harbors within its tangible form the formless true essence. Only through refining and purifying can the mysterious pearl manifest. Once the pearl appears, it returns to the furnace—being and non-being merge, the two *qi* harmonize, like shadow following form, like echoes to sound. Naturally, the heart congeals while the form dissolves; bones and flesh melt away, form and spirit both attain marvelous transformation, merging with the Dao in truth.

The Venerable Lord of Double Yang’s sacred annotation states:
*The elixir lies within; the medicine comes from without—*
*Yet it is truly born from within.*

Why? For the spirit arises from form. Since this substance exists, a point of the primordial is present in every person, inherently possessed by all.

The worldly folk are lost in the true, following their passions instead.
Once their emotions and circumstances grow intimate,
They drift in the river of love, lost in the depths of desire.

Yet those who truly observe and awaken,
Having met a genuine teacher,
Are shown the primordial **Dao/Way** of the single **qi**—
The medicine comes from without, depending upon form to arise.

The method of acquisition is simply this:
To forget emotions, forget form,
To abandon will and embrace emptiness,
With not a thought arising,
In stillness reaching utter quietude,
When suddenly the celestial light itself emanates—
Neither within nor without,
As if something exists,
Now revealed, now concealed,
Thus the **mysterious pearl** takes form.

How does the **mysterious pearl** come to take form?
It is because, in stillness and quietude,
The spirit clings to the **qi**,
The **qi** condenses and the essence solidifies,
Coalescing into a single grain of **elixir**—
Forever residing within the **elixir field**,
Its outer manifestation the **mysterious pearl**’s luminous form,
Like a lamp’s light within a chamber,
Illuminating the brilliance beyond the window.

*"The Celestial Root wanders through the Moon’s Cavern,*
*Thirty-six palaces bloom with eternal spring.*
*Wait for that single point to return on its own,*
*Within the body, transforming into four seasons’ spring."*

Nurturing the **elixir furnace**,
Light pierces the curtains—
This is called the **mysterious pearl**,
The external medicine,
The primordial true essence.

True **yang**-**qi** is the fire of **Dao/Way**,
Lead meeting **geng** gives birth—
At this time, it is fitting to dwell in stillness,
Only then can one acquire and return it.

When one perceives the **elixir field**’s fire blazing,
Both kidneys’ **qi** warm,
The Three Passes ascending and descending,
A single **qi** harmonizing and surging—
Like **tíróu** (clarified butter) pouring upon the crown,
Sweet dew nourishing the heart,
Inner visions boundless,
Words fail to describe them fully.

The primordial **yang**-**qi** gives birth,
At the moment of **One Yang Stirring**,
It further generates heaven and earth,
Distinguishing **Kàn** and **Kūn**—
The time of **Returning Yang** and **Changing Bones**.

From the union of parents’ essence,
The embryonic form gradually matures over ten months,
**Qi** full and form complete, giving rise to the body—
That single point of luminous essence, primordial **yang**-**qi**,
Is already contained within.

Once this body exists,
Then **yin** is bound to **yang**,
Within the Five Phases,
Death and life, nobility and lowliness,
None can escape it.

Having obtained the primordial true **yang**-**qi**,
Returned to the body as the **elixir furnace**,
Engaging with the posterior true **yin**-**qi**,
The two **qi** intermingle,
Forming the **embryonic body** of the immortal.

Refining the Five Phases in reverse,
Counteracting the workings of **Creation**—
At the juncture of **thirty-six thousand breaths**,
Not deviating by a hair’s breadth,
Only then is the **fire candidate** achieved,
Not diminished by a thread.

Requiring ten months’ labor to complete,
The **embryonic body** sheds and ascends—
The Five Phases cannot constrain,
**Yin** and **yang** cannot mold.

The whole body’s turbid **yin**,
Completely transformed into pure **yang**,
Breaking free from the cage,
Scattering boundlessly in carefree ease!

**Editor’s Note:**
This section first speaks of the origin of **external delight**,
Then the method of acquisition,
Next the **Small Heavenly Cycle**’s practice,
And its boundless inner visions.

Again, the **Great Heavenly Cycle**’s practice of ten months,
The **spirit’s** transcendent visions—
Three years of **nursing the elixir**,
Nine years of **facing the wall**,
Breaking free from the cage,
Becoming the **carefree Heavenly Immortal**—
Yet its beginning is with the primordial true **yang**-**qi**,
As the **elixir**’s mother.

**Iddhi** (超凡功力) arises from refining oneself to mastery,
Only then can one achieve the primordial **Creation**.

The **mysterious pearl** takes form,
**Great Unity** (太乙) contains the true essence—
Form and spirit both attain marvelous transformation,
Merging with the **Dao/Way** in truth.

All this unfolds naturally,
Without contrivance or effort.

The Venerable Lord of **Double Yang**’s sacred annotation states:
*"Within the twenty-six hours,*
*Reverse and cultivate—*
*Do not follow the familiar path of emotions,*
*Hold fast to the **Dao/Way**’s thought,*
*The eyes do not wander after colors or scenes,*
*The ears do not chase after sounds or circumstances,*
*The nose does not linger upon fragrances or filth—*"

The tongue does not wander after flavors or sensory realms;
The body does not succumb to tactile desires or sensory realms.
The mind does not follow emotional or familiar realms.

Awareness remains ever luminous,
Luminous yet ever serene.
Thus, by not yielding to human emotions and familiar realms,
Over time, the natural **Dao/Way**’s essence becomes pure and true—
Refining oneself is refining the mind.

The mind is **li** (離), **li** being the realm of one’s own **earth** (土).
When the mind is refined and unmoved,
This is called **leaving the palace** (離宮) and practicing **meditation** (修定).
**Meditation** brings **qi** into harmony,
Harmony brings bodily ease,
Ease fills the body with **jing-qi** (精氣),
Fullness causes **lead** (鉛) and **mercury** (汞) to congeal,
Congealment brings forth **Creation** (造化) naturally,
The **mysterious pearl** (玄珠) takes form,
**Great Unity** (太乙) contains the true essence—
**Gold liquid refines the form** (金液鍊形),
Bones transmute into **cold jade** (寒琼),
Form and spirit both achieve marvelous transformation,
Merging with the **Dao/Way** in truth—
All this unfolds naturally.

If one does not diligently uphold and guard,
Subduing the mind and refining the nature,
There will be no natural attainment of **Dao/Way**.

Yet this practice requires a resolute and fearless heart,
A will to abandon life and forget death,
Only then can one achieve mastery.

When the heart is slain, the spirit becomes alive—
This is what is meant.

**Chapter One: The Jade Liquid Chapter**
The spirit does not depart from **qi**,
**Qi** does not depart from the spirit.
Breathing in and out, returning to a single source,
It cannot be grasped by the body,
It cannot be manipulated by effort.
Surrender the will to emptiness,
Serene yet ever luminous,
Body and mind in non-action,
While the spirit and **qi** naturally act.

Like the heavens and earth in non-action,
Yet all things naturally transform and nurture.
The Venerable Lord of **Double Yang**’s sacred annotation states:
*"Primordial **yang**-**qi** (先天一氣) emerges from emptiness,
Two **qi**s intermingle, naturally the spirit embraces **qi**,
**Qi** embraces the spirit—
The **qi** of the **First Heaven** (先天) and **Second Heaven** (後天) intermingle and support each other,
Naturally as indistinct as drunken dreams,
Uncontrived and effortless, without a trace of manipulation.
Inhale, and it is **qi**;
Exhale, and it is the spirit—
Spirit exhales, **qi** inhales,
Ascending and descending without cease,
Returning to its original source,
Refining and congealing into the **elixir**,
Forming its embryo.
Body and mind in great **meditation** (大定) and non-action,
While the spirit and **qi** naturally act—
Surrender the will to emptiness,
Do not dwell on thoughts,
Like the heavens and earth’s **meditation** (定) and stillness,
Naturally the **yang**-**qi** ascends and **yin**-**qi** descends,
Called the **receding moon and advancing moon** (往月來),
And thus **Creation** (造化) nurtures all things.
The Venerable Lord of **Double Yang**’s sacred annotation states:
When refining oneself reaches mastery,
The practice of stillness endures long,
Naturally the spirit and **qi** unite.
The spirit belongs to the **south** (南方), the **fire** (火) of **li** (離);
**Precise essence** (精) belongs to the **north** (北方), **water** (水) of **kǎn** (坎).
The **hun** (魂) belongs to the **east** (東方), **wood** (木) of **zhèn** (震);
The **pò** (魄) belongs to the **west** (西方), **metal** (金) of **duì** (兌).
The mind belongs to the **center** (中央), **earth** (土) of **kūn** (坤).
This is called the **Central Palace of Yellow Court** (中宮黃庭),
The **Primordial Pass** (先天玄關) is **gān** (干).
When the spirit and **qi** unite,
The spirit enters **qi**,
Naturally the Five Elements and Four Symbols converge—
This is the function of **kǎn-lǐ** (坎離) intermingling.
**Pure yin** (純陰) is refined by **fire** (火),
Meaning the spirit descends and illuminates the **kūn** (坤) Palace,
Obscure and mysterious,
Yet the true **qi** emerges naturally—
This is called **One Yang Reborn** (一陽生而為複).
**Chapter Two: The Birth of the Medicine Chapter**
The spirit guards the **kūn** (坤) Palace,
True **fire** (真火) comes naturally.
The **kūn** (坤) Palace is the birthplace of the medicinal elixir,
The source of the **yin-yang** (陰陽) intermingling.
The Venerable Lord of **Double Yang**’s sacred annotation states:
*"The **kūn** (坤) Palace is the **Yellow Court** (黃庭) within the human body.
It is below the heart, above the kidneys,
West of the liver, east of the lungs—
Before the kidneys, behind the navel wheel,
The hollow center where true **qi** (真氣) arises.
From the parental womb, the essence of one’s body,
Its connection like a ring,
Its whiteness like silk,
First forming the **Three Elements** (三元),
Then the **Two Kidneys** (兩腎),
The kidneys formed, gradually the **Two Eyes** (兩目),
Then the **Two External Kidneys** (兩外腎).
The **Three Talents** (三才) complete,
The **Five Zang** (五臟) and **Six Fu** (六腑),
The **Four Limbs** (四肢) and **Hundred Bones** (百骸),
Gradually take form.
This hollow center is the **Palace of Ancestral Qi** (祖氣之宮),
Thus called the **kūn** (坤) Palace—
**kūn** (坤) means to bear and nurture all things,
Truly the birthplace of the medicinal elixir,
The realm of **yin-yang** (陰陽) intermingling.
The spirit guards the **kūn** (坤) Palace,
Day and night without pause,
The **original spirit** (元神) descends and illuminates,
Returning light to stillness and **meditation** (定),
Reversing **Creation** (造化),
Opening the **Heavenly Gate** (天關),
From which the great medicine arises,
And the **elixir** (金丹) congeals.
If true **fire** (真火) does not refine,
Then **lead** (金) and **water** (水) remain mixed;
If the mind is not wholly focused,
Then **yang**-**fire** (陽火) scatters aimlessly,
And the great medicine will never arise—
How then can the primordial **Dao/Way** be attained?
With prolonged refining,
**Water** (水) sees **fire** (火) and naturally transforms into **One Qi** (一氣),
Ascending and perfuming,
The **River Vehicle** (河車) transports it,
Circulating endlessly—
True **jing** (精) arises from this,
And **original qi** (元氣) takes its embryonic form.
Breathing in and out unites,
Pulse ceases, **qi** halts,
Stillness generates **meditation** (定),
Within great **meditation**,
Primordial **One Qi** (先天一氣) emerges from emptiness,
Thus the **mother qi** (母氣) of the primordial.
While the **post-heavenal child qi** (後天子氣) lies dormant,
Follow its natural course,
Do not seek haste—
The primordial **Dao/Way** will naturally manifest.
The Venerable Lord of **Double Yang**’s sacred annotation states:
*"The **fire** (火) of the **kūn** (坤) Palace is the **fire** of the **True Person** (真人).
Always illuminate the **kūn** (坤) Palace with the spirit,
Refining **yin-yang** (陰陽),
**Jing** (精) transforms into **qi** (氣).
Focus the mind with unwavering resolve,
In all activities—walking, standing, sitting, lying—
Guard it intentionally, never allowing it to scatter.
If no progress is seen after long practice,
It is due to the mind’s chaos.
If refining endures long,
**Jing** (精) is refined by **fire** (火),
Naturally transforming into **One Qi** (一氣),
Day by day, **Three Reflections** (三震),
Resonance ascends to the **mud pellet** (泥丸),
Transforming into **sweet dew** (甘露),
Descending to the **Double Tower** (重楼),
Congealing into **jing-liquid** (精液),
Returning to the **kūn** (坤) position,
Nurturing the **original qi** (元氣),
Gradually growing robust—
Spirit exhales, **qi** inhales,
Naturally embracing and nurturing,
Circulating endlessly—
When **qi** and pulse cease,
Stillness and **meditation** (定) arise.
Within great **meditation**,
Sudden movement occurs—
This is the emergence of primordial **One Qi** (先天一氣),
From the **gān** (干) Palace,
Like a mother’s love for her child,
Naturally sensing and uniting—
The spirit’s transformation is unfathomable,
Listen to its natural course,
Do not seek haste—
When the time comes, **qi**-transformation will naturally show its effects."*

「The **Celestial Light** is the **Spirit Light**. With prolonged stillness, the Spirit Light shines forth, and stillness brings forth the Spirit’s clarity—penetrating within and without, manifesting outwardly. Colors and forms cannot obstruct it; desires and passions cannot hinder it. Thus, one naturally perceives objects through walls and foreknows past lives.

At the beginning of **Chaos** (混沌), before Heaven and Earth were distinguished, **primordial darkness** (玄) and **primordial brightness** (黄) intermingled. When the time of **Qi-transformation** (氣化) arrives, movement arises within **Great Meditation** (大定). Only at this point of movement does one recognize the **Creative Process** (造化). If there is a single entity—whether manifest or hidden, neither fully within nor fully without—this is the **Great Elixir** (大药) beginning to form; it must not be hastily gathered.

If even a single thought arises, the **True Essence of Heaven** (天真) will be lost!

The **Venerable Annotation of the Emperor of Double Yang** (重陽帝君聖注) states:
*"Heaven’s light and clear **Qi** reside above, its hue **primordial darkness** (玄); Earth’s heavy and turbid **Qi** resides below, its hue **primordial brightness** (黄). Before Heaven and Earth were distinguished, they were a unified **Qi**, with **primordial darkness** and **brightness** undivided, and **clear** and **turbid** yet undefined, merging into **Chaos** (混沌). When **Qi-transformation** arrives, the **clear Qi** ascends to become Heaven, and the **turbid Qi** descends to congeal as Earth. Earth’s **Qi** rises, Heaven’s **Qi** descends—the two **Qi**s intermingle and transform, giving birth to all things. So too is the function of **purity and stillness** (清净).

The **True Essence of Primordial Yang** (先天真陽) and the **True Essence of Posterior Yin** (後天真陰) merge as one, just as **primordial darkness** and **brightness** intermingle in Heaven and Earth. Suddenly, within **Great Meditation**, movement arises, and the **Creative Process** manifests—like the distinction of Heaven and Earth, where **Kūn** (坤) and **Gān** (干) are established.

If there is a single entity—whether manifest or hidden—this is the **Primordial Pearl** (玄珠) taking form. Though it seems to be outside, closing the eyes reveals it clearly; though it seems to be inside, opening the eyes shows only purity. When it has form, others cannot see it; when it has no form, only you perceive it clearly. Hence, it is called the **Formless Primordial Pearl** (無象玄珠).

This is the **Great Harmony Elixir** (大樂) beginning to sprout. Its **Elixir** is still tender; thus, it must not be gathered. If one rashly seizes it with delusion, one will lose the **Primordial Pearl** and squander the **True Essence of Heaven**’s most precious treasure, falling into **demonic frenzy** (魔狂), with **Qi** and breath in disarray—an irredeemable state. **Life’s Essence** (命寶) must not be trifled with; this is its meaning!

**Chapter Three: Gathering the Elixir**
Guard the Spirit in the **Gān Palace** (干宮), and the **True Qi** will naturally return. The **Gān Palace** is the source of the **Creative Process**, the origin of the birth of the physical form. To know this and refine it is to be a **Sage**.

The **Venerable Annotation of the Emperor of Double Yang** states:
*"The **Kūn Palace** (坤宮) belongs to Earth as **Yin**, corresponding to the human **posterior Qi** (後天) with its finite form; the **Gān Palace** belongs to Heaven as **Yang**, corresponding to the human **primordial Qi** (先天) without beginning or end. The **Gān Palace** is the **void and formless** (虛無) **primordial gateway** (玄關), a single aperture—truly the source of the **Creative Process**.

From the **void** to the **form**, this is called **Creative Process** (造); from the **form** to the **void**, this is called **transformation** (化)—a cycle of **Creative Process** and **transformation**. Initially, one receives **Qi** from the **void and formless** aperture and is born; finally, one dissipates the **essence** into the **six thieves** (幻妄六賊) and dies. The **Creative Process** revolves endlessly—countless **eons** (劫) pass!

First, the Spirit congeals in the **Kūn Palace**, refining **Yin Essence** (陰精) into **Yang Qi** (陽氣), which ascends and permeates, carried by the **River Vehicle** (河車) in ceaseless circulation. Next, the Spirit congeals in the **Gān Palace**, gradually refining and congealing, gradually gathering and forming—a **Primordial Pearl** (玄珠) emerges, as large as a millet grain, ever-present before you. Once obtained, it is forever yours. The **True Qi of Primordial Void** (先天虛無真氣) naturally returns to it.

Wait until its **lead-light** (鉛光) shimmers like the moon’s image; wait until its **mercury-Qi** (汞氣) soars like the sun’s radiance. When the sun and moon converge in one place, a single luminous point—round and radiant, shining brightly above and below—emerges, with **internal truth** (內真) and **external response** (外應). The **Qi of Primordial Void** arises from the **void** itself, thus it is the **mother-Qi** (母氣), while the **child-Qi** (子氣) lies dormant within. They naturally sense and unite.

The marvel of the **Creative Process** lies in the **Elixir** coming from without, not through artificial contemplation.

The **Venerable Annotation of the Emperor of Double Yang** states:
*"The adept of **True Essence** (修真之士) receives Heaven and Earth’s **Yin** and **Yang Qi** to be born. The **True Yang Qi** within the body is **lead** (鉛), **essence** (精), and **Kān** (坎); the **True Yin Qi** within the mind is **mercury** (汞), **Spirit** (神), and **Lí** (離).

The symbolism states: *The human body shares the same essence as Heaven and Earth’s **Qi**.

Once the **Great Elixir** begins to sprout and the **Primordial Pearl** takes form, the **True Qi** within the adept grows robust. At this juncture, the **Spirit within Essence** descends to unite with **Kān**; the **Spirit within Essence** ascends to unite with **Lí**. Internally, **Spirit** and **Essence** merge within; externally, **Yin** and **Yang** merge without. Inner and outer clarity shines forth—above and below—transforming into a **Bright Pearl** (明珠), round and radiant, ascending and descending through the **three pass gates** (三關), rotating endlessly like a wheel, in ceaseless circulation.

Such a vision is the moment when **internal Spirit** and **Essence** harmonize, when **metal** (金) and **wood** (木) intermingle, and **water** (水) and **fire** (火) are aroused within. This is the moment when **True Treasure** (真寶) resides within, thus its image responds externally. Without personally cultivating the **true realm** (真境), how could such a scene arise?

The **Qi of Primordial Void** is the **mother-Qi**; the **Qi of Posterior Essence** is the **child-Qi**. They naturally unite, returning to the marvel of the **Creative Process**, and thus the **Elixir** comes from without.

The **mother-Qi** is **Heaven’s Qi**; the **child-Qi** is **human Qi**. If one maintains **purity and stillness**, all of Heaven and Earth will return to them. **Heaven’s Qi** returns to a single body, becoming a **Natural Person** (自然人). Then, one takes **Heaven’s Qi** to govern the **Nine Heavenly Souls** (九天魂)—this is the meaning of **kindred harmony** (同類).

The **Primordial Kūn** and **Posterior Gān** (先坤後干) is also called **moving the furnace and changing the cauldron** (移爐換鼎). This is the **true essence** (真竅妙) of the **Golden Elixir** (金丹) and the **secret method** (秘訣) of **Primordial Fire’s Refining** (元天火候).

When first refining the **Elixir**, one seeks it in **water** (水), only to end in **stubborn emptiness** (顽空), ultimately achieving nothing. One must use one’s **True Qi** to resonate with the **most refined essence** of Heaven and Earth, applying the principle of **Yang Burner** (陽燧) to **water and fire** (水火) to sense and communicate. The **Venerable Annotation of the Emperor of Double Yang** states:

*"When first refining the **Elixir**, one must first have the Spirit illuminate the **Kūn Palace**, using **fire** to refine the **medicine** (药), and the Spirit to govern **Qi**. Once the **True Qi** arises, one then guards the **Gān Palace**, suspending the embryo within the **cauldron** (鼎), forming the **Primordial Pearl**, refining it into the **Great Elixir**, and swallowing it into the abdomen. It then transmutes one’s own **Yin Qi** into the **form of Gān Yang** (干陽之體)—this is the **true void’s** (真空) wondrous application."*

The people of this age do not comprehend the wondrous application of the **true void** (真空). Without encountering a **sage of ultimate attainment** (至人) for transmission, they rely on hearsay and blindly refine, seeking the Elixir in water—water being the realm of **obscure and murky** (杳冥). Forgetting both mind and body within this murk, how could they not fall into **stubborn emptiness** (顽空)? Ultimately, they will never achieve the **Elixir**.

The **Yang Burner** (陽燧) is the **Fire Pearl** (火珠), the **True Palace of the Great Yang** (太陽正宮). One directs the **Fire Pearl** toward the sun to ignite it; the **Water Pearl** (水珠) is the **True Palace of the Great Yin** (太陰正宮), directing the **Water Pearl** toward the moon. Though Heaven and Earth are suspended in vast separation, within a moment, one naturally attains **water and fire**. Even objects that receive **Qi** unevenly can resonate with the sun and moon—how much more so the human, the **root of all things** (萬物之靈根)?

Within **stillness and composure** (靜定), does one not resonate with the **marvelous transformations** within the body, forming the **Golden Elixir**?

**Chapter Four: Obtaining the Elixir—Divine Guard of the Mysterious Palace**
Guard the **Mysterious Palace** (玄宮) with the **Spirit**, welcome the **Feminine Chamber** (牝府) with the **Mind**—when **Spirit** and **Mind** unite, the **Primordial** (先天) is naturally attained. In **dim and obscure** (恍恍惚惚, 杳杳冥冥) states, a **point of red light** flashes into the **Lower Elixir Field** (下元). One’s **True Qi** gathers naturally, **Yin** embraces **Yang**, **Yang** stirs **Yin**, and the **most refined essence** emerges, waves surging in the **Sea of Vitality**. Rising from the **Great Mysterious Pass** (太玄關) into the **Mud Pillow** (泥丸), it transforms into **Golden Elixir**, swallowed into the abdomen—fragrant, sweet, and crisp. **Ten thousand pores** bloom with vitality, the body radiates light. At this point, **Heaven and Earth unite in copulation** (乾坤交媾), and the **mystery of eternal attainment** is revealed. All depends on **warding off peril and guarding against danger**, sealing tightly to prevent leakage, fostering **nourishment and warmth**.

The **Venerable Annotation of the Emperor of Double Yang** states:
*"The **Mysterious Palace** (玄宮) is the **Mysterious Pass** (玄關), where the refining of **glutinous rice** (黍米) occurs. It is also called the **Suspended Embryo Cauldron** (懸胎鼎), the **Cinnabar Cauldron** (朱砂鼎), and the **Gān-Kūn Cauldron** (干坤鼎)—these are but different names. Earlier, when speaking of **Gān-Kūn**, it referred to the **initial Elixir refining**, using **Gān-Kūn** as the **cauldron-vessel**. First, one condenses the **Spirit** and gathers it at the **Kūn position**. Within stillness arises movement—extracting **Yang** from within **Yin**, called **Freeing the Marrow** (免髓). When **True Qi** ascends, it rises into the **Gān Palace**; movement followed by stillness—merging **Yin** within **Yang**, called **Black Liver** (烏肝). These two substances blend and refine into the **Willful Pearl** (如意之珠). This is the **union of Kān-Lǐ** (坎離交媾), the emergence of the **Jǐ Flower** (癸花), the first appearance of **True Lead** (真鉛), the **Primordial** beginning to manifest, the moment when **One Yang first stirs**—like the **third day of the moon’s cycle**, when the moon emerges in the **Gēng sign** (庚之象), the very **active childbirth hour** (活子時).

Divide this hour into **six watches** (六候). The **first watch** is when the **Elixir is obtained**. Having obtained the **first watch’s Elixir**, one should enter a **quiet chamber**, using **natural fire** to refine further, entering the **Dui-Ding** (兑丁) phase. A **half-moon** appears—at this time, there are **Dragon’s roars and Tiger’s howls**. **Lead and Mercury** may leak; it all depends on **cleansing the mind and purifying thoughts**, bathing and reinforcing defenses. Gradually passing the **thirteenth day**, **Gān-Jiā** (干甲) is born—this is the **fifteenth day**. This day is **full and complete**, the **time of Gān-Kūn**. **Yīn-Yù** (鄞鄂) is formed, the **Mysterious Female** (玄牝) is established, the **Golden Flower** (金花) appears, and the **Three Yangs** (三陽) are complete. The moon is full in the **Jiā direction**, corresponding to the **Gān symbol**. Fearful that the **Golden Elixir** may drift too far, this is precisely the moment when **sun and moon both shine brightly**—the **second watch** for obtaining the **Elixir**.

The **fourth watch** has its own marvelous applications, symbolizing the **first half of the month**. Within the **half-moon’s glow**, there are **Dragon’s roars and Tiger’s howls**—one must consider **warding off peril and guarding against danger**.

After the **Embryonic Sage** (仙胎) forms, by the **eighteenth day**, in the **Xùn-Yīn** (巽陰) position, there are the **mysteries of defending the city and waging battle**. Next, refining the **second Yin**, on the **twenty-third day**, the **washing of the heart and bathing in the Gǒn-Earth** (艮地) has its applications. Having refined the **three Yins**, the **Yang Spirit** emerges—this is the **mystery of reinforcing the dikes and ensuring passage**.

These are the **first three threes** and **last three threes** of the **four watches**, the **logic of the two watches** for obtaining the **Elixir**.

**Divine Guard of the Mysterious Palace, Welcoming the Feminine Chamber**—these two lines are the **incantation for gathering the Elixir**. When within the **Mysterious Palace**, the **most refined essence** emerges, and the **True Lead’s Qi** manifests as a **wheel of bright moon**; the **True Mercury’s fire** appears as a **wheel of red sun**. Within the sun and moon, each emits **two Golden Flowers**, vast as **Red Mountains**, golden-red in hue. At this moment, neither **too old nor too young**, one must **urgently gather and take them**. How does one gather and take? The **incantation says**: *"Only welcome the Feminine Chamber."* Naturally, in **dim and obscure** states, a **point of red light** flashes into the **Lower Elixir Field**, meeting the **True Yin**. **Yin** gathers naturally, **Yin** stirs **Yang**, **Yang** embraces **Yin**, and **Yin-Yang** surge, waves crashing in the **Sea**. From the **Great Mysterious Pass** to the **Tailbone Spine**, passing the **Jade Pillow**, it transforms into **Golden Elixir and Nectar**, swallowed into the abdomen—fragrant, sweet, and crisp. The ears hear **drumbeats**, **ten thousand sounds** like thunder, **Heaven’s Pinion Music**—neither **zither nor se**, neither **flute nor shawm**, but a **wondrous sound unlike any other**: like **cold springs rinsing jade**, like **golden plates clanging in emptiness**, like **autumn cicadas drawing silk**, like **wind rustling green pines**. **Línláng resounds**. There are **crowds of crows cawing**, **birds chirping in harmony**. The mouth is filled, the eyes dazzled, the heart joyful, the mind delighted—truly the **Land of Ultimate Bliss**, the **Celestial Palace’s Marvelous Realm**. **Worldly mortals**, like the **blind and deaf**, cannot perceive it. With **body and mind in purity**, the **ten thousand passes** harmonize, **ten thousand pores** bloom with vitality, the body radiates **ten thousand rays of light**, and a **round light** appears within, bearing the **image of an infant**—this is the **Yang Spirit’s manifestation**. All depends on **warding off peril and guarding against danger**; one must not stray far. **Chapter Five: Nourishment and Warmth** follows.

The **Spirit dwells in the Yellow Chamber**, and the **Golden Embryo** forms naturally. The **Yellow Chamber** is the space beneath the **Heavenly Stem (干)** and above the **Earthly Branch (坤)**, the marvel within the **circular measure (规中)**. Within the **twelve hours**, ever-mindful, **light contained and radiance hidden**. In **moving, standing, sitting, or lying**, ever-present like a hen brooding her egg, like a dragon nurturing its pearl. **Embrace the Primordial, guard the One**—the **Preheaven Essence-Spirit and Essence-Qi** merge moment by moment, transforming gradually.

Only **calm the spirit and rest**, and **fire moves without effort**; in **a hundred days**, the **function manifests**; in **ten months**, the **embryo is complete**, the **Yin soul dissolves**, and the **Yang Spirit appears**. After **a thousand days**, **nurture the fire to sufficiency**, exhaust all **Yin impurities**, the body becomes **pure Yang**, the **infant form manifests**, a **second body beyond the physical**, like **mist and clouds**, the **Spirit harmonized with the Great Void**. When **hidden**, form merges with spirit; when **manifest**, spirit merges with **qi**. **Treading sun and moon without trace**, piercing **metal and stone without hindrance**.

After **three years of nurturing**, the **infant matures**; do not stray far. Until **nine years**, it **unites with the Great Void**, form and spirit both perfected, **aligned with the Dao/Way and True Reality**. Though **heavens, earth, mountains, and rivers** may crumble, **this Dao/Way-body endures through cataclysms**. Concealed among mortals, **accumulating merit and practice**, **lifting heaven and earth**, **grasping Yin and Yang**—thus **Yin and Yang cannot forge or constrain**.

The **Dao/Way of Heavenly Immortals** is now complete!

**The Holy Annotation of the Emperor of Double-Nine** states:
The **Yellow Chamber** is the **Yellow Court Palace (黄庭宫)**, thus beneath the **Heavenly Stem (干)** and above the **Earthly Branch (坤)**, within the **circular measure (规矩)**. The **Golden Embryo** is the **Immortal Embryo**; gold is **unyielding and unbreakable**, this being the **Primordial Spirit**. This **Primordial Spirit** is **indestructible and immortal**, a **pure, subtle, and wondrous** essence—**as firm as gold, as sharp as steel**, **clear as crystal, bright as a full moon**, its **luminosity unwaning**, yet lost through **a single deluded thought**. It arises from **illusion and transformation**.

Now, having cultivated the **five-sections’ oral precepts**, attaining the **returning elixir Dao/Way**, one must **refine the union of presence and absence**, **cast black to form red**, and **complete the Immortal Embryo**. Returning to **original True Constancy**, merging with **Primordial Beginning’s marvelous function**, the **Golden Embryo forms naturally**. The **marvel within the circular measure** is **guarded by the Spirit**. Within the **Yellow Chamber**, the **mind must not scatter**. In the **twelve hours**, ever-mindful, **light contained and radiance hidden**, **eyes withdrawn, ears gathered**, ever-present like a hen brooding her egg, like a dragon nurturing its pearl.

The dragon nurtures the **pearl beneath its throat**; with **mind and intent unbroken**, **spirit transforms it**, and the pearl **emits light**. As the **light endures**, the pearl becomes a **small dragon**, soaring through the **Great Void**, now **released, now withdrawn**—when mortals see it, it is the **form of the dragon**, the **Spirit of the dragon**. The **Spirit’s transformations**—**summoning clouds, bringing rain, shedding bones to fly**—this is the **Spirit-Dragon**. Thus it can **expand or shrink**, **conceal or reveal**. In **action**, it **splits mountains, raises tides**, **summons clouds, evokes mist**, **drags lightning, thunders**. In **stillness**, it **hides in deep springs**—a **Yang numinous essence**.

The **Golden Elixir Dao/Way** for those who **pursue Heavenly Immortality** follows this principle. Initially, **embrace the Primordial, guard the One**, nurturing the **Preheaven millet-grain**—the **Essence-Spirit’s marvelous pearl**. The **Scripture of Passage** says:
*"The Primordial Beginning Heavenly Venerable suspended a **treasure pearl**, five zhang above the earth, within the void. **Ten thousand saints and true ones** emerged from its mouth, **boiling and surging**, then re-entered through its mouth."*

Nurturing it long, the **Primordial Spirit millet-grain** naturally **meets and transforms**, like **new moon to crescent, half-moon to full**. **Gold light emerges**, **sun and moon unite in a single orb**, **lead and mercury merge**, and the **Immortal Embryo forms**. After **three years of nurturing**, the **infant matures**. Until **nine years**, the **practice is complete**, **Yin dross exhausted**. **One Spirit can transform into ten thousand spirits**; form and spirit both perfected—**emerging without trace, refining without end**—the **Spirit merges with the Great Void**, returning to the **True Dao/Way of the Non-Ultimate**, uniting with the **Primordial Beginning’s marvelous realm**.

Observe **heaven and earth within profound mystery**—like **a single millet grain in the Great Granary**, **a single cloud in the Great Void**! What **Five Phases** can bind it? What **Yin-Yang transformations** can alter it? Here, **heaven and earth are lifted by me**, **Yin and Yang grasped by me**—**eternal without end**, enduring through **cataclysms**, **aligned with the Dao/Way and True Reality**. **Awe-inspiring! Awe-inspiring!**

The compiler explains: The *Production of Elixirs* chapter states: **"The Yellow Court Palace lies *before the inner kidneys and behind the navel wheel, at the hollow orifice of the central void*."** Master Liu Hua-yang of the True Dao/Way declares: **"The orifice is the Dantian; above it is the Golden Cauldron, slightly above the cauldron is the Yellow Court; below the orifice is Guanyuan. The ancients said, ‘Above is the Yellow Court, below is Guanyuan,’ and so it is."** Further, he says: **"The Yellow Court, Golden Cauldron, Dantian, and Guanyuan—these four orifices are indistinct in form. If one seeks them by fixating on form, one will err!"** Thus, the Yellow Court, Golden Cauldron, Dantian, and Guanyuan merge as one: **when the *qi* is active, the orifice forms; when the mechanism ceases, it vanishes into obscurity.** Beginners cannot distinguish them, nor need they distinguish them.

Master Liu further declares: **"The Dantian’s orifice is *right behind the kidneys, slightly forward of the inner kidneys, seven parts in front and three behind, suspended in the center as a hollow cavity*."** This aligns precisely with what the Emperor of Double Yang indicated, thus revealing Master Liu’s teachings had their own foundation.

**For those who cultivate the Dao/Way, it is like a dragon nurturing a pearl.** With time, **the Spirit undergoes full transformation**, **manifesting and concealing at will**—this is called the **Spirit Dragon**. Just as ordinary mortals, through cultivation, attain the principle of becoming Heavenly Immortals, **the explanation is rendered with such intimacy!**

The *Scripture for Transcending Mortals and Granting Infinite Life*—**"The Supreme Lord’s Mystic Essence Scripture of the Spiritual Treasure for Transcending Mortals"**—is said to have been composed by the **Primordial Beginning Heavenly Venerable** during the early **Lónghàn** era. The *sutra* can be recited and invoked, and it also **prolongs the Elixir and extends vision**.

The phrase **"The Primordial Beginning Heavenly Venerable suspends a single precious pearl, five zhang above the earth"** refers to **only those who truly cultivate and truly verify** can speak of this.

What is meant by **"lifting heaven and earth, grasping Yin and Yang"**?
It is the same as **Master Wu Chong-xū’s** **"harmonizing the Heavenly and Earthly"**—**the True Dao/Way of the Non-Ultimate**.

After the adept attains the rank of Heavenly Immortal, **a single luminous Spirit shines steadfastly for eight thousand kalpas**, its **enlightened radiance enveloping the Three Thousand Great Thousand Worlds**. Within this luminous sphere, **all flying birds and walking beasts, all human movements and thoughts—whether benevolent or malevolent—are exposed without concealment**.

**Wherever in heaven and earth there are conditions unfit for human survival, the adept modifies them**; **wherever in phenomena there are threats to human life, the adept reverses the Yin-Yang mechanisms beforehand to eliminate them**—this is what is meant by **lifting heaven and earth, grasping Yin and Yang**.

**The Holy Annotation of Master Zhongyang on the *Five Chapters of Sacred Texts***

**Preface**
This text is the supreme treasure of *Jindan* [alchemical elixir]. It cannot be passed on to just anyone. If one of the highest caliber—great virtue’s heir—encounters this book, it is the true path to immortality.

Master Zhongyang’s Holy Annotation says:
Immortals are divided into five ranks. *Gui xian* [ghostly immortals] are unworthy of pursuit; *ren xian* [human immortals] need not be discussed. *Di xian* [earthly immortals] dwell in the world for many years. *Shen xian* [spiritual immortals] emerge and vanish beyond measure, hidden yet manifest, possessing a body beyond the body. Those who can dual their essence—these are called *shen xian* [spiritual immortals].

*Tian xian* [celestial immortals] stand above *shen xian* [spiritual immortals]. Seekers of the Dao/Way should not be content with mediocre or lower ranks. They must study the supreme and ultimate truth of the highest vehicle, the wondrous Dao/Way beyond compare.

To penetrate the mysteries of Heaven and Earth’s yin-yang, to grasp the transformations of the Five Phases [wood, fire, earth, metal, water]. The words *yin* and *yang* hold the greatest principle—Heaven, Earth, sun, moon, and the Five Phases all arise from them.

When the *Tai ji* [Supreme Ultimate] was divided, the pure *qi* ascended to form celestial phenomena; the turbid *qi* descended to shape terrestrial forms. The essence of wood and fire became the *Tai yang* [Greater Yang, the sun]; the splendor of metal and water became the *Tai yin* [Greater Yin, the moon]. Heaven, Earth, sun, and moon are born from the interplay of these two *qi*, transforming into existence.

These two *qi* circulate endlessly between Heaven and Earth, generating all things. Yet, as for human life—it draws upon the father’s vital essence and the mother’s blood, Heaven’s *yang qi*, Earth’s *yin qi*, the sun’s *yang hun* [soul], the moon’s *yin po* [spirit], fire’s *yang shen* [spirit], and water’s *yin jing* [essence]. Within a single human body, the transformations mirror those of Heaven and Earth, sharing the same *qi*.

Heaven and Earth are humanity’s grand progenitors. Those who awaken transcend the yin-yang of Heaven and Earth; those who remain deluded sink into the suffering of the myriad phenomena. To be unbound by the Five Phases’ constraints and yin-yang’s shackles—this is the highest rank of *tian xian* [celestial immortals]. Those who fail to awaken descend with the Creator, alas!

Master Zhongyang’s Holy Annotation says:
*Tian xin* [Heavenly Mind] is the true, wondrous heart of *Miao yuan* [profound unity]. The *Shi jie* [Buddhist teachings] call it the *Miao ming zhen xin* [wondrously clear true mind]. The mind is inherently wondrous and clear, untouched by defilement, pure and unadulterated. The slightest attachment is called delusion.

This mind is the root of the *Tai ji* [Supreme Ultimate], the formless void, the origin of yin-yang, the heart of Heaven and Earth—thus it is called *Tian xin* [Heavenly Mind]. The *Yuan shen* [Primordial Spirit] is the unborn, unending, incorruptible true essence, not the errant heart of thought and fancy. *Tian xin* [Heavenly Mind] governs the *Yuan shen* [Primordial Spirit], while the *Yuan shen* [Primordial Spirit] manifests the wondrous workings of *Tian xin* [Heavenly Mind].

Thus, the *Ru ru* [thusness, immovable] *Miao yuan Tian xin* [wondrously unified Heavenly Mind] is the master, while the *Bu huai bu mie* [unperishable, unobscured] *Ling miao Yuan shen* [wondrously subtle Primordial Spirit] is its function.

The Three Treasures [Buddha, Dao, Patriarch] serve as its foundation: the outer Three Treasures are not lost, and the inner Three Treasures are naturally harmonized.

Master Zhongyang’s Holy Annotation says:
The inner Three Treasures are *jing* [essence], *qi* [energy], and *shen* [spirit]; the outer Three Treasures are the ears, eyes, and mouth. One must seal them shut—do not let them leak.

If the eyes gaze upon colors, the spirit leaks through the eyes;
if the ears listen to sounds, the essence leaks through the ears;
if the mouth speaks, the *qi* leaks through the mouth.
When sight, hearing, and speech are stirred by external forces, the essence, energy, and spirit are daily consumed within. Gradually, one weakens and ages; when exhausted, death follows.

The Three Treasures are preserved when:
the eyes do not wander in vain,
the ears do not listen in vain,
the mouth does not speak in vain—
this is called the outer Three Treasures not leaking.
The eyes do not see, and the spirit remains in the heart;
the ears do not hear, and the essence remains in the kidneys;
the mouth does not speak, and the *qi* remains in the *Dan tian* [elixir field]—
this is called the inner Three Treasures naturally contained.

At first, one attains harmony between Heaven and humanity. The *qi* of the primordial Dao/Way naturally returns to its source.

Master Zhongyang’s Holy Annotation says:
*Tian* [Heaven] refers to the *qi* of the primordial Dao/Way;
*Ren* [humanity] refers to the form of the post-heavenly body.
Those who cultivate immortality must, in all their actions—whether moving, resting, sitting, or lying—nurture the *Ru ru bu dong Tian xin* [immovable Heavenly Mind] and the *Ling miao bu mie Yuan shen* [unobscured Primordial Spirit]. Thus, the eyes will not wander in vain, the ears will not listen in vain, and the mouth will not speak in vain. The inner truth responds externally, and the primordial *qi* naturally harmonizes, returning to my body from the void.

Yet, within a human’s inner and outer self, the Four Great [elements] above and below are all post-heavenly yin-yang. Only the primordial point of supreme *yang qi* remains, hidden in the unfathomable depths, utterly subtle and wondrous, difficult to seek or perceive.

Master Zhongyang’s Holy Annotation says:
Within a human body, there are the four limbs and myriad bones externally, and the five viscera and six bowels internally. Even tears, saliva, *jin jing* [semen and vaginal fluids], *qi*, blood, and fluids—all are tangible forms, belonging to post-heavenly turbid yin. This single point of supreme *yang qi* is the primordial *Zhen yi* [true unity] *qi* of the Dao/Way, called the *Tai yi* [Great Unity] *Han zhen qi* [containing true *qi*].

The "dim and indistinct" refers to the source of the primordial Dao/Way’s emergence. To reveal this supreme *yang qi* of the Dao/Way, there is no other method—only the practice of stillness.

The Dao/Way of stillness lies in dispelling delusive thoughts. Observing that the body is entirely empty, motionless and tranquil, suddenly the true *yang* appears in the dim and indistinct—sometimes present, sometimes absent, unfathomable, beyond sight or measure, neither inner nor outer, arising without knowing how. Thus it is.

Master Zhongyang’s Holy Annotation says:
All things carry yin within and embrace *yang*. Though a human’s Four Great [elements] belong to turbid yin, within lies a point of primordial *Yuan yang* [original *yang*], inherently endowed with innate knowledge and ability, inherently wondrous and clear.

Yet, the seven emotions and six desires assault from within, while cold, labor, heat, and toil strike from without, scattering the primordial *yang* and leaving one unaware, descending with the transformations of fate!

To know and cultivate—retracting sight and listening, forgetting external things while embracing the true—sight and hearing do not leak through sounds and colors; the wondrous and subtle do not leak through thoughts and fancies. The true essence is naturally preserved, and the primordial spirit is naturally replenished. The inner truth responds externally, and the primordial *qi* emerges from the void, illuminating the *Jindan* [alchemical elixir] within the body. Thus, though it comes from without, it is truly born within.

chunks.original_text: 是以母气而伏子气，神抱于气，气抱于神。 当斯之际，丹田温暖，三关升降，上下冲和，醍醐灌顶，甘露洒心，钧天妙乐，耳中常闻，至宝玄珠，目中常见，此乃真景象也，非譬喻也。 「真精既返黄金室，一颗明珠永不离。 」岂虚言哉! 先天若无后天，何以招摄？ 后天不得先天，岂能变通？ 此乃无中生有，有中生无。 无因有激之而成象； 有因无感之而通灵，先后二天之气，如谷之应声。 重阳帝君圣注曰：先天者，入于无象； 后天者，滞于有形。 先天者，真净妙明之心也； 后天者，端严具足之形也。 先天妙明真性，本来清净，无始以来，一念垂珠，至于今日，若不得后天具足之体招摄，则阴灵孤妙。 后天具足之体，若不得先天灵妙之元神，则不能变化通灵，岂能超凡入圣？ 夫性命者，神气之根源也。 气者天一之水，神者太乙含真，性者无中之有象，命者有中之虚无。 命无性不灵，性无命不立。 无者是先天之性，神者真一之气也； 有者后天之命，气者真一之精也。 此有形阴质，因一点无象阳气而生，此有形之内，怀无象之真，必假煅炼澄清，方得玄珠显象，玄珠既显，采归炉内，有无混融，二气感通，如影之随形，如谷之应声，自然心凝形释，骨肉都融，形神俱妙，与道合真。 重阳帝君圣注曰：金丹在内，药从外来，实由内孕。 何也？ 盖神依形生，既有此物，一点先天，在人身个个不无，人人本有。
chunks.translated_text:
The mother-*qi* conceals the child-*qi*, the spirit embraces the *qi*, and the *qi* embraces the spirit. At this juncture, the *dantian* grows warm, the three passes ascend and descend in harmony, the upper and lower merge in balance—*tíhuò* [clarified butter] pours upon the crown, sweet dew showers the heart, the celestial *jiǔtiān* [wondrous music] resounds ever in the ears, the supreme treasure of the *xuánzhū* [mysterious pearl] is ever seen in the eyes. This is the true manifestation—no mere metaphor.

*"True essence returned to the Yellow Room of Gold,*
*A single bright pearl forever undivided."*

Is this idle speech? If the primordial had no dependence on the subsequent, how could it be summoned and gathered? If the subsequent fails to grasp the primordial, how could it transform and adapt? This is the emergence of being from non-being, and non-being from being. Non-being stirs into form through the impetus of being; being awakens to subtlety through the resonance of non-being. The *qi* of the two heavens—primordial and subsequent—responds like echoes to sound.

The Venerable Lord of Double Yang’s sacred annotation states:
*The primordial enters the formless void;
The subsequent lingers in tangible form.
The primordial is the heart—true, pure, wondrous, and clear;
The subsequent is the body—complete and solemn in its fullness.*

The primordial’s wondrous, clear, and true nature is inherently pure and untainted. From beginningless time, a single thought has hung like a pearl, until today. If it fails to summon the subsequent’s complete form, then the yin-spirit remains solitary and refined. The subsequent’s complete form, if it lacks the primordial’s wondrous and subtle essence, cannot transform or awaken to subtlety—how then could it transcend the mundane and attain sainthood?

For life and nature are the root of spirit and *qi*. *Qi* is the water of Heaven’s One; spirit is the True One containing essence. Nature is the form within non-being; life is the void within being. Life without nature lacks vitality; nature without life cannot stand. Non-being is the primordial nature, the spirit of True Unity; being is the subsequent life, the *qi* of True Unity’s essence.

This tangible yin-substance, born from a single point of formless yang-*qi*, harbors within its tangible form the formless true essence. Only through refining and purifying can the mysterious pearl manifest. Once the pearl appears, it returns to the furnace—being and non-being merge, the two *qi* harmonize, like shadow following form, like echoes to sound. Naturally, the heart congeals while the form dissolves; bones and flesh melt away, form and spirit both attain marvelous transformation, merging with the Dao in truth.

The Venerable Lord of Double Yang’s sacred annotation states:
*The elixir lies within; the medicine comes from without—*
*Yet it is truly born from within.*

Why? For the spirit arises from form. Since this substance exists, a point of the primordial is present in every person, inherently possessed by all.

chunks.original_text: 世人迷真顺情，情境既熟，爱河流浪，欲海波深。 实观觉悟之者，得遇真师，指示这先天一气，药从外来，依形而生。 采取之法，只是忘情忘形，委志虚无，一念不生，静中至寂，忽然天光自发，不内不外之间，若有一物，或明或隐，乃玄珠成象。 玄珠因何而成象？ 皆因静寂之时，神抱于气，气结精凝，结成一粒金丹，永在丹田之内，外现玄境之象，犹如室内之灯光，照透窗外之明朗。 「天根月窟闲来往，三十六宫都是春，待他一点自归后，身中化作四时春。 」温养丹鼎，光透帘帏，此之谓玄珠，外药也，先天真元也。 真阳火也，铅遇癸生也，于斯之时，宜当于静，方可采取归来。 自觉丹田火炽，两肾气暖，三关升降，一气冲和，醍醐灌顶，甘露酒心，内景无穷，笔难尽述。 先天气生，即一阳动时，更生天地，别立乾坤，回阳换骨之时也。 人自父母媾精，胎形十月渐满，气足形全而生身，其一点灵光元阳之气，已含于内。 既有此身，则阴系阳，五行之内，死生贵贱，莫能逃也。 既得先天真阳，归于身内，假作炉鼎，与后天真阴交媾，二气氤氲，结成仙胎。 返炼五行，逆施造化，当三万刻工夫，不差毫发，方得火候，不减丝毫。 须要十月功成，脱胎飞升，五行不能拘，阴阳不能陶。 通身阴浊，尽化纯阳，跳出樊笼，散荡逍遥无穷矣！ 编者说明：本节初言外乐之由来，次言采取之法，再言小周天功法，及其无穷之内景。 复言大过天十月功法，出神之景，三年乳哺，九年面壁，跳出樊笼，成逍遥之天仙，然其始也，则以先天真阳之气，以为金丹之母。 郄从炼己纯熟，方得先天造化。 玄珠成象，太乙含真，形神俱妙，与道合真。 此皆自然而然，不假一毫作为也。 重阳帝君圣注曰：二六时中，逆而修之，不顺熟境，勤持道念，目不随色顺境； 耳不随声逐境； 鼻不随香臭境；
chunks.translated_text:
The worldly folk are lost in the true, following their passions instead.
Once their emotions and circumstances grow intimate,
They drift in the river of love, lost in the depths of desire.

Yet those who truly observe and awaken,
Having met a genuine teacher,
Are shown the primordial **Dao/Way** of the single **qi**—
The medicine comes from without, depending upon form to arise.

The method of acquisition is simply this:
To forget emotions, forget form,
To abandon will and embrace emptiness,
With not a thought arising,
In stillness reaching utter quietude,
When suddenly the celestial light itself emanates—
Neither within nor without,
As if something exists,
Now revealed, now concealed,
Thus the **mysterious pearl** takes form.

How does the **mysterious pearl** come to take form?
It is because, in stillness and quietude,
The spirit clings to the **qi**,
The **qi** condenses and the essence solidifies,
Coalescing into a single grain of **elixir**—
Forever residing within the **elixir field**,
Its outer manifestation the **mysterious pearl**’s luminous form,
Like a lamp’s light within a chamber,
Illuminating the brilliance beyond the window.

*"The Celestial Root wanders through the Moon’s Cavern,*
*Thirty-six palaces bloom with eternal spring.*
*Wait for that single point to return on its own,*
*Within the body, transforming into four seasons’ spring."*

Nurturing the **elixir furnace**,
Light pierces the curtains—
This is called the **mysterious pearl**,
The external medicine,
The primordial true essence.

True **yang**-**qi** is the fire of **Dao/Way**,
Lead meeting **geng** gives birth—
At this time, it is fitting to dwell in stillness,
Only then can one acquire and return it.

When one perceives the **elixir field**’s fire blazing,
Both kidneys’ **qi** warm,
The Three Passes ascending and descending,
A single **qi** harmonizing and surging—
Like **tíróu** (clarified butter) pouring upon the crown,
Sweet dew nourishing the heart,
Inner visions boundless,
Words fail to describe them fully.

The primordial **yang**-**qi** gives birth,
At the moment of **One Yang Stirring**,
It further generates heaven and earth,
Distinguishing **Kàn** and **Kūn**—
The time of **Returning Yang** and **Changing Bones**.

From the union of parents’ essence,
The embryonic form gradually matures over ten months,
**Qi** full and form complete, giving rise to the body—
That single point of luminous essence, primordial **yang**-**qi**,
Is already contained within.

Once this body exists,
Then **yin** is bound to **yang**,
Within the Five Phases,
Death and life, nobility and lowliness,
None can escape it.

Having obtained the primordial true **yang**-**qi**,
Returned to the body as the **elixir furnace**,
Engaging with the posterior true **yin**-**qi**,
The two **qi** intermingle,
Forming the **embryonic body** of the immortal.

Refining the Five Phases in reverse,
Counteracting the workings of **Creation**—
At the juncture of **thirty-six thousand breaths**,
Not deviating by a hair’s breadth,
Only then is the **fire candidate** achieved,
Not diminished by a thread.

Requiring ten months’ labor to complete,
The **embryonic body** sheds and ascends—
The Five Phases cannot constrain,
**Yin** and **yang** cannot mold.

The whole body’s turbid **yin**,
Completely transformed into pure **yang**,
Breaking free from the cage,
Scattering boundlessly in carefree ease!

**Editor’s Note:**
This section first speaks of the origin of **external delight**,
Then the method of acquisition,
Next the **Small Heavenly Cycle**’s practice,
And its boundless inner visions.

Again, the **Great Heavenly Cycle**’s practice of ten months,
The **spirit’s** transcendent visions—
Three years of **nursing the elixir**,
Nine years of **facing the wall**,
Breaking free from the cage,
Becoming the **carefree Heavenly Immortal**—
Yet its beginning is with the primordial true **yang**-**qi**,
As the **elixir**’s mother.

**Iddhi** (超凡功力) arises from refining oneself to mastery,
Only then can one achieve the primordial **Creation**.

The **mysterious pearl** takes form,
**Great Unity** (太乙) contains the true essence—
Form and spirit both attain marvelous transformation,
Merging with the **Dao/Way** in truth.

All this unfolds naturally,
Without contrivance or effort.

The Venerable Lord of **Double Yang**’s sacred annotation states:
*"Within the twenty-six hours,*
*Reverse and cultivate—*
*Do not follow the familiar path of emotions,*
*Hold fast to the **Dao/Way**’s thought,*
*The eyes do not wander after colors or scenes,*
*The ears do not chase after sounds or circumstances,*
*The nose does not linger upon fragrances or filth—*"

chunks.original_text: 舌不随味美境； 身不随触欲境； 意不随情熟境。 觉而常照，照而常寂。 如斯不顺人情熟境，久久自然天理纯真，炼己即炼心也。 心为离，离者己土也。 炼心不动，即离宫修定，定则气和，和则身安，安则精气充满，满则铅汞凝结，结则造化自有，玄珠成象，太乙含真，金液炼形，骨化寒琼，形神俱妙，与道合真，皆自然也。 若非操持谨守，降心炼性，必无自致之理。 然此工夫，必加勇猛决烈之心，舍死忘生之志，乃可纯熟矣。 心死方得神活，此之谓也。 玉液章第一 神不离气，气不离神，呼吸往来，归乎一源，不可着体，不可运用，委志虚无，寂然常照，身心无为，而神气自然有所为。 犹天地无为，万物自然化育。 重阳帝君圣注曰：先天一气，自虚无中来，二气相交，自然神抱于气，气抱于神，先后二天之气，相交相得者，浑如醉梦，自然而然，无一毫作为也。 吸则气，呼则神，神呼气吸，上下往来，复归于本源，炼结成丹，为之胎。 身心大定无为，而神气自然有所为，委志虚无，不可存想，犹如天地之定静，自然阳升阴降，曰往月来，而造万物也。 重阳帝君圣注曰：炼己纯熟，工夫静久，自然神气交合。 神属南方火，人在卦为离； 精属北方水，水在卦为坎。 魂属东方木，木在卦为震； 魄属西方金，金在卦为兑：意属中央土，土在卦为坤。 名曰中宫黄庭，先天玄关为干。 既神与气合，神入气中，自然五行四象攒簇，是为坎离交媾之功也。 纯阴用火，谓凝神下照坤宫，杳杳冥冥，而得真气发生，谓一阳生而为复也。 产药章第二 神守坤宫，真火自来。 坤宫乃产药川源，阴阳交媾之处。 重阳帝君圣注曰：坤宫乃人身中黄庭宫也。 即心下肾上，肝西肺东，内肾之前，脐轮之后，中虚之窍，真气发生之所。 人自父母胞胎，一身之精粹，其连如环，其白如练，先生三元，后生两肾，两肾既生，渐生两目，后生两外肾。 三才既全，五脏六腑，四肢百骸，渐次而生。 此一窍乃祖气之宫，故曰坤宫，坤乃承载万物之谓也，实为产药川源之处，阴阳交媾之所也。 神守坤宫，要昼夜之间，时刻不离，元神下照，回光静定，逆施造化，拨转天关，大药自此而生，金丹由是而结也。 若不得真火煅炼，则金水混融； 若不专心致志，则阳火散漫，大药终不能生，先天何由而得？ 煅炼之久，水见火则自然化为一气，熏蒸上腾，河车搬运，周流不息，真精自此而生，元气胚胎于此。 呼吸相合，脉住气停，静而生定，大定之中，先天一气，自虚无中而来。 是以先天母气。 而伏后天子气，顺其自然，不可欲速，先天自发也。 重阳帝君圣注曰：坤宫之火，曰真人之火也。 常以神照坤宫，煅炼阴阳，精化为气：专心致志，于行住坐卧之间，皆可随意守之，不可散乱。 日久而不见其功者，皆因心中杂乱。 若煅炼之久，精得火炼，自然化为一气，日久三震，响上泥丸，化为甘露，降下重楼，凝为精液，便归坤位，胚胎元气，渐渐壮旺，神呼气吸，自然含育，周流不息，气脉以停，而入静定。 大定之中，忽然而动，乃先天一气发生，自干宫而来，如母恋子，自然感合，神变莫测，听其自然，不可欲速，时至气化，自然见其功效也。

Awareness remains ever luminous,
Luminous yet ever serene.
Thus, by not yielding to human emotions and familiar realms,
Over time, the natural **Dao/Way**’s essence becomes pure and true—
Refining oneself is refining the mind.

The mind is **li** (離), **li** being the realm of one’s own **earth** (土).
When the mind is refined and unmoved,
This is called **leaving the palace** (離宮) and practicing **meditation** (修定).
**Meditation** brings **qi** into harmony,
Harmony brings bodily ease,
Ease fills the body with **jing-qi** (精氣),
Fullness causes **lead** (鉛) and **mercury** (汞) to congeal,
Congealment brings forth **Creation** (造化) naturally,
The **mysterious pearl** (玄珠) takes form,
**Great Unity** (太乙) contains the true essence—
**Gold liquid refines the form** (金液鍊形),
Bones transmute into **cold jade** (寒琼),
Form and spirit both achieve marvelous transformation,
Merging with the **Dao/Way** in truth—
All this unfolds naturally.

If one does not diligently uphold and guard,
Subduing the mind and refining the nature,
There will be no natural attainment of **Dao/Way**.

Yet this practice requires a resolute and fearless heart,
A will to abandon life and forget death,
Only then can one achieve mastery.

When the heart is slain, the spirit becomes alive—
This is what is meant.

**Chapter One: The Jade Liquid Chapter**
The spirit does not depart from **qi**,
**Qi** does not depart from the spirit.
Breathing in and out, returning to a single source,
It cannot be grasped by the body,
It cannot be manipulated by effort.
Surrender the will to emptiness,
Serene yet ever luminous,
Body and mind in non-action,
While the spirit and **qi** naturally act.

Like the heavens and earth in non-action,
Yet all things naturally transform and nurture.
The Venerable Lord of **Double Yang**’s sacred annotation states:
*"Primordial **yang**-**qi** (先天一氣) emerges from emptiness,
Two **qi**s intermingle, naturally the spirit embraces **qi**,
**Qi** embraces the spirit—
The **qi** of the **First Heaven** (先天) and **Second Heaven** (後天) intermingle and support each other,
Naturally as indistinct as drunken dreams,
Uncontrived and effortless, without a trace of manipulation.
Inhale, and it is **qi**;
Exhale, and it is the spirit—
Spirit exhales, **qi** inhales,
Ascending and descending without cease,
Returning to its original source,
Refining and congealing into the **elixir**,
Forming its embryo.
Body and mind in great **meditation** (大定) and non-action,
While the spirit and **qi** naturally act—
Surrender the will to emptiness,
Do not dwell on thoughts,
Like the heavens and earth’s **meditation** (定) and stillness,
Naturally the **yang**-**qi** ascends and **yin**-**qi** descends,
Called the **receding moon and advancing moon** (往月來),
And thus **Creation** (造化) nurtures all things.
The Venerable Lord of **Double Yang**’s sacred annotation states:
When refining oneself reaches mastery,
The practice of stillness endures long,
Naturally the spirit and **qi** unite.
The spirit belongs to the **south** (南方), the **fire** (火) of **li** (離);
**Precise essence** (精) belongs to the **north** (北方), **water** (水) of **kǎn** (坎).
The **hun** (魂) belongs to the **east** (東方), **wood** (木) of **zhèn** (震);
The **pò** (魄) belongs to the **west** (西方), **metal** (金) of **duì** (兌).
The mind belongs to the **center** (中央), **earth** (土) of **kūn** (坤).
This is called the **Central Palace of Yellow Court** (中宮黃庭),
The **Primordial Pass** (先天玄關) is **gān** (干).
When the spirit and **qi** unite,
The spirit enters **qi**,
Naturally the Five Elements and Four Symbols converge—
This is the function of **kǎn-lǐ** (坎離) intermingling.
**Pure yin** (純陰) is refined by **fire** (火),
Meaning the spirit descends and illuminates the **kūn** (坤) Palace,
Obscure and mysterious,
Yet the true **qi** emerges naturally—
This is called **One Yang Reborn** (一陽生而為複).
**Chapter Two: The Birth of the Medicine Chapter**
The spirit guards the **kūn** (坤) Palace,
True **fire** (真火) comes naturally.
The **kūn** (坤) Palace is the birthplace of the medicinal elixir,
The source of the **yin-yang** (陰陽) intermingling.
The Venerable Lord of **Double Yang**’s sacred annotation states:
*"The **kūn** (坤) Palace is the **Yellow Court** (黃庭) within the human body.
It is below the heart, above the kidneys,
West of the liver, east of the lungs—
Before the kidneys, behind the navel wheel,
The hollow center where true **qi** (真氣) arises.
From the parental womb, the essence of one’s body,
Its connection like a ring,
Its whiteness like silk,
First forming the **Three Elements** (三元),
Then the **Two Kidneys** (兩腎),
The kidneys formed, gradually the **Two Eyes** (兩目),
Then the **Two External Kidneys** (兩外腎).
The **Three Talents** (三才) complete,
The **Five Zang** (五臟) and **Six Fu** (六腑),
The **Four Limbs** (四肢) and **Hundred Bones** (百骸),
Gradually take form.
This hollow center is the **Palace of Ancestral Qi** (祖氣之宮),
Thus called the **kūn** (坤) Palace—
**kūn** (坤) means to bear and nurture all things,
Truly the birthplace of the medicinal elixir,
The realm of **yin-yang** (陰陽) intermingling.
The spirit guards the **kūn** (坤) Palace,
Day and night without pause,
The **original spirit** (元神) descends and illuminates,
Returning light to stillness and **meditation** (定),
Reversing **Creation** (造化),
Opening the **Heavenly Gate** (天關),
From which the great medicine arises,
And the **elixir** (金丹) congeals.
If true **fire** (真火) does not refine,
Then **lead** (金) and **water** (水) remain mixed;
If the mind is not wholly focused,
Then **yang**-**fire** (陽火) scatters aimlessly,
And the great medicine will never arise—
How then can the primordial **Dao/Way** be attained?
With prolonged refining,
**Water** (水) sees **fire** (火) and naturally transforms into **One Qi** (一氣),
Ascending and perfuming,
The **River Vehicle** (河車) transports it,
Circulating endlessly—
True **jing** (精) arises from this,
And **original qi** (元氣) takes its embryonic form.
Breathing in and out unites,
Pulse ceases, **qi** halts,
Stillness generates **meditation** (定),
Within great **meditation**,
Primordial **One Qi** (先天一氣) emerges from emptiness,
Thus the **mother qi** (母氣) of the primordial.
While the **post-heavenal child qi** (後天子氣) lies dormant,
Follow its natural course,
Do not seek haste—
The primordial **Dao/Way** will naturally manifest.
The Venerable Lord of **Double Yang**’s sacred annotation states:
*"The **fire** (火) of the **kūn** (坤) Palace is the **fire** of the **True Person** (真人).
Always illuminate the **kūn** (坤) Palace with the spirit,
Refining **yin-yang** (陰陽),
**Jing** (精) transforms into **qi** (氣).
Focus the mind with unwavering resolve,
In all activities—walking, standing, sitting, lying—
Guard it intentionally, never allowing it to scatter.
If no progress is seen after long practice,
It is due to the mind’s chaos.
If refining endures long,
**Jing** (精) is refined by **fire** (火),
Naturally transforming into **One Qi** (一氣),
Day by day, **Three Reflections** (三震),
Resonance ascends to the **mud pellet** (泥丸),
Transforming into **sweet dew** (甘露),
Descending to the **Double Tower** (重楼),
Congealing into **jing-liquid** (精液),
Returning to the **kūn** (坤) position,
Nurturing the **original qi** (元氣),
Gradually growing robust—
Spirit exhales, **qi** inhales,
Naturally embracing and nurturing,
Circulating endlessly—
When **qi** and pulse cease,
Stillness and **meditation** (定) arise.
Within great **meditation**,
Sudden movement occurs—
This is the emergence of primordial **One Qi** (先天一氣),
From the **gān** (干) Palace,
Like a mother’s love for her child,
Naturally sensing and uniting—
The spirit’s transformation is unfathomable,
Listen to its natural course,
Do not seek haste—
When the time comes, **qi**-transformation will naturally show its effects."*

chunks.original_text: 天光者，神光也。 工夫久静，神光照烛，静则神灵，表里透澈，发现于外。 色象不能碍，爱欲不能障，自然隔墙见物，预知前世矣。 混沌之初，天地未判，玄黄相杂，时至气化，定中生动。 只这动处，方知造化，若有一物，或明或隐，不内不外，此是大药始萌，不可遽采之。 若有一毫念起，天真遂丧矣！ 重阳帝君圣注曰：天之轻清在上，其色玄； 地之重浊在下，其色黄。 天地未判之前，浑沦一气，玄黄不分，清浊未定，混而为一。 时至气化，清气上浮为天，浊气下凝为地。 地气上升，天气下降，二气氤氲，化生万物。 清净之功亦然，先天真阳，与后天真阴，阴阳混一，犹如天地玄黄相杂，忽然定中生动，造化自现，如天地一判，别立乾坤是也。 若有一物，或明或隐，乃玄珠成象也。 此玄珠似乎在外，闭目甚分明； 似乎在内，开眼却清白。 有象，他人不能见：无象，独自见分明，故曰无象玄珠。 乃是大乐之苗始生，其药尚嫩，故不可采，若有妄念采之，必失玄珠，丧却天真至宝，反成魔狂，呼吸乱奔，不可救也。 命宝不可轻弄，其斯之谓也! 采药章第三 神守干宫，真气自归。 干宫乃造化之源，生身受气之初。 知之修炼，谓之圣人。 重阳帝君望注曰：坤宫属地为阴，应人后天有终之形； 干宫属天为阳，应人先天无始之神。 干宫乃虚无玄关一窍是也，实为造化之源。 自无而有，谓之造； 自有而无，谓之化，由造而化也。 始则受气于虚无一窍而生，终则散精于幻妄六贼而死，造化循环，不知几万劫矣！ 始则凝神于坤，煅炼阴精，化为阳气，熏蒸上腾，河车搬运，周流不息。 次则凝神于干，渐炼渐凝，渐聚渐结，结成一颗玄珠，大如黍米，恒在目前，一得永得，先天虚无真气，自然归之。 待其铅光闪烁，如月之象； 汞气飞扬，如日之象，日月交合一处，一点灵光，圆陀陀，光烁烁，照耀上下，内真外应。 先天之气，自虚无中而来，是以母气，而伏子气，自然感合。 造化之妙，药从外来，非假存想。 重阳帝君圣注曰：人禀天地阴阳二气以生，真阳之气在身，为铅为精为坎； 真阴之气在心，为汞为神为离。 象曰，人与天地之气同体是也。 修真之士，既得大药始萌，玄珠成象，而内精神壮旺。 当此之际，神中之精，下交于坎； 精中之神，上交于离。 内则精神交合于内，外则阴阳交合于外，内外明彻，照耀上下，化为一颗明珠，圆陀陀，光烁烁，三关升降，上下旋转如轮，周流不息。 如斯景象，是内之精神和合，金木交并，水火激发之际，是内有真宝，故外应其景象也。 若非亲造真境，岂能有此哉!先天之气，母气也； 后天之气，子气也，自然戚合，返斯造化之妙，始得药从外来。 母气天气也，子气人气也。 人能常清净，天地悉皆归，天气归一身，皆成自然人，还将上天气，以制九天魂，此同类之谓也。 先坤后干者，又名移炉换鼎是也。 此乃金丹之真窍妙，元天火候之秘诀也。 初炼丹时，便向水中求之，终落顽空，毕竟无成。 须以我之真气，而感天地之至精，当以阳燧方诸水火感通之理，推之自得。 重阳帝君圣注曰：初炼丹时，先须神照坤宫，以火炼药，以神驭气。 待真气发生，后守干宫，悬胎鼎内，结成玄珠，炼成大药，吞入腹中，点化己之阴气，变成干阳之体，此真空之妙用也。
